Author: hastrup#8742
Content:
@Markus it was lower back in December. I'm just waiting for that sweet 0.50 cent again I did not buy enough back then but this time I'm going all in, can't wait.!!
Look at it like this.
We are still two to three years from Mildly mass adoption.
The tech, brains the right people here. But it is still a gamble to think kmd will be here after the dust have settle. There is a good chance kmd and some few others still be here. Delivering amazing tech as always. My biggest concern is the crypto space especially kmd because of the Decentral nature of it is going to be regulated to death. Yes there is a market for it and ppl will use it but like kazar Napster lime wire and tpb was mega huge back in the 00 but now not so much now. What do you guys think? Will komodo be just another tpb?

Author: Markus#5464
Content: In my opinion KMD itself should only focus on tech and to build new things and have a company to focus only on promoting it nothing else

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: That is what has been forming

Author: Markus#5464
Content: but who is going to promote it?

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Kmd will remain an open source project as it always has been.   A company has been formed to be able to take on clients and to leverage our network of professionals for Komodo related work.   When it is ready to be public it will but in the meantime just getting all the things in place to be able to interact with the conventional world.

Author: Markus#5464
Content: I think it would be amazing if KMD had 1 person who is very skilled when it comes to communicating with ppl and know  how to talk infront of ppl, this persons job would be to travel around the world and attend crypto related events non stop

Content: Benny?

Author: hastrup#8742
Content: And kmd he is using kmd tech

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Presenting at conferences is draining,  most of the networking is done on the floor anyway.

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Not an easy position to fill

Author: Markus#5464
Content: Im not very sure how such events work but i could imagine that it would be a shortcut to create potential partnerships if there is larger companies interested in new tech

Author: Markus#5464
Content: that attend those events

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Its about fulfilling those requests.  Ive spoken at around a dozen crypto events for Komodo.  Getting interested parties isnt the issue, fulfilling their needs is.   And while Komodo is making in roads to newbie developer friendliness,  most projects tend to underestimate there developer needs and even with our service providers  there is not enough Komodo specific hired help available to tackle large projects.

Author: Markus#5464
Content: Also another thing im sure will put more clearance into KMD's tech would be to make simplified videos that compare and explain why things solve current problems, for example at this moment when it comes to AtomicDEX it just shows u can use it on mobile, you can store your crypto in the same app and u can also trade using new technology. I think a explainer video with comparing how a centralized exchange work compared to how AtomicDEX work would make ppl think and view it in a different way

Author: Markus#5464
Content: with cons and pros

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: I have enough work to keep all of our service providers busy for years if necessary but until the tech has hardened for production use, just have to work on other aspects of adoption.    @Markus  I believe marketing team is looking at making videos

Author: Markus#5464
Content: Ye i dont doubt that new ideas for kmd team ever gonna be a problem üôÇ Just wanted to bring some thoughts i had incase it would bring new ideas what already had not been thought of üòÑ

Content: lulz

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: y'all so friendly. I expect there to be lots of misunderstanding and dislike of some things, and that is why we are doing it all in the open, so later on nobody can accuse us of nefarious things (but they still will)

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I am mostly excited because I am learning more about provably burning coins, and using @Alright's new code to do it

Author: joe2x4#5987
Content: So burning 160,000 random coins = burning premine, which is different coins. Am I missing something?

Author: LocoMB#8593
Content: yeah, who (still) owns the premine? and where did the burned coins come from?

Author: tolken#2655
Content: @dukeleto just make sure you use the right decimal point.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @joe2x4 we are burning an amount equal to the premine, but we never had access to the actual pre-mine coins. These funds come from Cryptopia 51% attacker

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Deleted User https://github.com/jl777/komodo/pull/1675

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @LocoMB the original pre-mine was sold and paid out to Hush members before I joined the team. As far as I can tell, most of the pre-mine was sold for project expenses in 2017/2018. Some former Hush people got a salary of something like 2000HUSH/month, paid from that original premined funds. I never received any of that money

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @LocoMB the current funds, which we are burning, came from the 51% attacker on Cryptopia

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I made a new Hush mainnet and did not airdrop the attacker funds to the new chain. Then everyone got to choose which chain they wanted to be on

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I have control of those funds currently, which means I can burn funds/etc. This is because I created the new Hush mainnet

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: When you make a new AC, and you use -ac_supply > 0, then in block 1 you get those coins. I airdropped all balances except to the attacker. The old chain was never turned off, it was as decentralized as you can get

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: People finally stopped mining that old chain a few months ago

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: There are more details in this WP: https://github.com/MyHush/hush-v3-whitepaper/blob/master/hush-v3.pdf

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Deleted User if you can do some testing, to see how stuff renders on explorers, that would be super useful üòâ

Author: joe2x4#5987
Content: No complaints from me. This is not the first time though that a project with new leadership has attempted to address a premine in this mannor. Not sure the world really cares about premines though. Just look at Darkcoin, total scammy behavior from day 1. Their Dev should have def gone to jail based on all the info people provided back in the day. Lots and lots and lots of manipulation. But as the old saying goes "fake it till you make it". They sure as hell faked it so hard they had to rebrand. What is that shit stain of a coin called now? Oh yeah, Dash.
